root: ^The sun glares over you, and your ship is in pieces around you.
^In stark contrast to the raging waters that overwhelmed you and your ship last night,
^The storms of yesterday seem to have died down for now.
^In front of you are large tropical trees that seem to stretch on forever.
^One tree seems to have fallen down, and underneath it...
^The creature has spotted you and they cry out in pain.

Amelia_encounter: ^Hey! What are you doing just standing there? Get me out of here!
^What do you do? Do you help the creature?
choiceNO: ^You decide it’s probably best not to draw attention to yourself.
^Besides, someone else might be able to help them out.
^You take a step in the opposite direction, which catches the attention of the creature in need.
repeatNO0: ^Are you seriously going to ignore someone in peril?
repeatNO1: ^Are you seriously going to ignore someone in peril?
repeatNO2: ^Are you seriously going to ignore someone in peril?
choiceYES: ^It’s what your gut is telling you, and it’s high time you started listening to your gut.
^You rush in and with a surge of power that feels like it came out of nowhere, you move the tree off the creature.
^As it crashes to the ground next to you, the creature stands up slowly, face tensing in pain.
^That’s more like it. Thought for sure I would be a goner there.
^I’m a little bruised, but I would be a lot worse for wear if it wasn’t for you.
^Amelia looks up at you, and recoils in horror.
^Hey, wait a minute? Are you a -
^Amelia jumps back, and assumes a fighting stance, arms raised, ready to fight for her life.
^Wait! I’m not going to hurt you.
^Likely story. You humans are all the same.
^Can’t believe a lousy human was the one that came to my rescue.
^I must have the worst luck ever.
^Clearly you’re just trying to make me lower my guard down,
^and then when I have my back turned,
^No way are you gonna pull the wool over my eyes. Now go! Back to wherever you came from!
^Why not? You got here on a boat didn’t you? Just sail back.
^I can’t. The boat’s wrecked. And, well…
^The words get caught up in your throat as you think back to the series of events that forced your way out of the nest not even 24 hours ago.
^Would a stranger you only just met understand, let alone care? Where would you even begin?

c-0: ^Well I don’t have all day for you to regale me with your life story.
^You’re a human, you’re not gonna last long out here alone.
c-1: ^You’re a human, you’re not gonna last long out here alone.

contfromchoice2: ^You remove your scarf, revealing the rest of your face, and the tentacles that recently sprouted from around your mouth.
^Huh. Well what are you doing, covering up like that?
^Are you on the run from humans or something?
^Well whatever your reasons are, it’s really easy to mistake you for a human in that get-up.
^If I were you I would ditch the scarf.
^Amelia starts walking off towards the forest.
^Wait. Do you know where I can find another ship?
^Not really. I know where you might be able to get more stuff to build a brand new one, but well...
^Just point me in the right direction then.
^Hang on, you can’t go out there on your own!
^Have you even ventured out there before?
^A greenhorn like you would surely die on your own.
^So you’re saying I should form a party then?
^Then join me. Help me build a ship out of here.
^What?! No no no - I only just met you,
^and you may not be a human, but you definitely reek of one!
^You said so yourself I would most likely die on my own, and I don’t see anyone else around here.
^That’s because most creatures are further in-land, and there’s absolutely no humans at all!
^Except for the ones living in the treetops I guess...
^So... does that mean you’ll come along with me?
^Look, I’m grateful you saved me from that tree and all, and I do owe you for that, but it’s a bit much to just ask a random stranger to tag along with you.
^Take care, and try not to die, okay?
^Amelia turns her back on Noelle, and starts walking off in the direction of the rainforests.
^Before Amelia can leave however, her stomach rumbles.
^When was the last time you ate?
^Hard to find food on this island when everything is trying to kill you.
^Would be pretty convenient if someone were to find some food for you.
^Would save you a lot of effort of doing it yourself.
^ of them, and maybe I will consider joining your party.
^You look around for something to help you catch some fish.
^In the wreckage of your old ship you find an old fishing rod.
^It’s nothing fancy, but it will do the trick.
^You find a spot on the beach where there are dark shapes of various sizes slowly moving about.
^You cast the fishing rod into the waters several times, hoping to catch the fish you need for your potential party member.
^POC quest has been added by the previous line of dialogue (id1)
^Below is the usual choice-based quest giver (id2)
SubmitQuest: ^Would you like to finish this quest?
^clicking on yes should remove quest with id 1 while no should do nothing
IncompleteQuest: ^this line of dialogue should play when player interacts with Amelia before completeing the quest.
^You better hurry before I change my mind.
CompleteQuest: ^this line of dialogue should play when player interacts with Amelia after completeing the quest.
^After a few tries, you get the 10 fish you need.
^You return back to Amelia, who’s sitting on the sand next to the wreckage of your ship.
^Please tell me you caught some salmon.
^The fish are a lot different around here compared to home
^Is that why you were on the ship when the storms stomach rumbles again
^While I would love to keep chatting, gimme the fish, quickly!
^You hand over the fish, and Amelia hastily gobbles it all down, bones, scales and all.
^That hit the spot! Anyway, see ya—
^But the reality is I still barely know you.
^And if you can catch that many fish in a short span of time, I’m sure you’ll be able to survive fine on your own.
^And I don’t really travel in groups anyway.
^The  haunting roar of a monstrous beast echoes throughout the island. Whatever you had to say is forgotten in the moment.
^Rain begins to fall on the island.
^How long do you think it will take for us to build a new ship and get off of this island?
^I dunno - I haven’t really built a ship on my own before and—
^However long you think we need, cut that time in half.
^Change of plans, I’m coming with you.
^Now come on, we need to go.
^Amelia takes Noelle’s hand, and drags her towards the rainforests deeper in-land.
